feed.title: Google Cloud: Google Distributed Cloud (software only) for bare metal
feed.subtitle: Changelog for Google Cloud product: Google Distributed Cloud (software only) for bare metal

entry.content:
Google Distributed Cloud for bare metal 1.31.800-gke.32 is now available for download. To upgrade, see Upgrade clusters. Google Distributed Cloud for bare metal 1.31.800-gke.32 runs on Kubernetes v1.31.10-gke.300.

After a release, it takes approximately 7 to 14 days for the version to become available for installations or upgrades with the GKE On-Prem API clients: the Google Cloud console, the gcloud CLI, and Terraform.

If you use a third-party storage vendor, check the Ready storage partners document to make sure the storage vendor has already passed the qualification for this release of Google Distributed Cloud for bare metal.
entry.summary: New version of Google Distributed Cloud for bare metal available.
entry.title: Announcement: Google Distributed Cloud for bare metal update

entry.content:
The following issues were fixed in 1.31.800-gke.32:

  • Fixed an issue where the CronJob for periodic health checks wasn't updating after configuration changes.
  • Fixed an issue that caused the Ansible playbook for handling Customer-Acquired Licenses (CAL) to fail and not complete.
  • Fixed vulnerabilities listed in Vulnerability fixes.
entry.summary: The CronJob for health checks and the CAL Ansible playbook were fixed. Vulnerabilities were also addressed.
entry.title: Fixed: Fixed Issues in Release

entry.content: For information about the latest known issues, see Google Distributed Cloud for bare metal known issues in the Troubleshooting section.
entry.summary: See the latest known issues.
entry.title: Issue: Google Distributed Cloud for bare metal known issues

entry.content:
Google Distributed Cloud for bare metal 1.30.1200-gke.63 is now available for download. To upgrade, see Upgrade clusters. Google Distributed Cloud for bare metal 1.30.1200-gke.63 runs on Kubernetes v1.30.12-gke.1200. This is the final patch for the 1.30 minor release.

After a release, it takes approximately 7 to 14 days for the version to become available for installations or upgrades with the GKE On-Prem API clients: the Google Cloud console, the gcloud CLI, and Terraform.

If you use a third-party storage vendor, check the Ready storage partners document to make sure the storage vendor has already passed the qualification for this release of Google Distributed Cloud for bare metal.
entry.summary: New release of Google Distributed Cloud for bare metal available. Upgrade instructions provided.
entry.title: Announcement: Google Distributed Cloud for Bare Metal Update

entry.content:
The following functional change was made in 1.30.1200-gke.63:

  • Updated the validation checks for cluster upgrades to enforce the cluster version skew rules for user clusters. If the upgrade version information for a user cluster doesn't comply with the version skew rules, the upgrade is halted.
entry.summary: Updated validation for cluster upgrades to enforce version skew rules.
entry.title: Changed: Cluster Upgrade Validation Update

entry.content:
The following issues were fixed in 1.30.1200-gke.63:

  • Fixed an issue where the CronJob for periodic health checks wasn't updating after configuration changes.
  • Fixed vulnerabilities listed in Vulnerability fixes.
entry.summary: Fixed an issue where the CronJob for periodic health checks wasn't updating after configuration changes and fixed vulnerabilities.
entry.title: Fixed: Fixed CronJob Update and Vulnerabilities

entry.content: For information about the latest known issues, see Google Distributed Cloud for bare metal known issues in the Troubleshooting section.
entry.summary: This document outlines the known issues for Google Distributed Cloud for bare metal.
entry.title: Issue: Known Issues

entry.content:
Google Distributed Cloud for bare metal 1.32.300-gke.85 is now available for download. To upgrade, see Upgrade clusters. Google Distributed Cloud for bare metal 1.32.300-gke.85 runs on Kubernetes v1.32.4-gke.1000.

After a release, it takes approximately 7 to 14 days for the version to become available for installations or upgrades with the GKE On-Prem API clients: the Google Cloud console, the gcloud CLI, and Terraform.

If you use a third-party storage vendor, check the Ready storage partners document to make sure the storage vendor has already passed the qualification for this release of Google Distributed Cloud for bare metal.
entry.summary: New version of Google Distributed Cloud for bare metal available.
entry.title: Announcement: Google Distributed Cloud for bare metal 1.32.300-gke.85 release

entry.content:
The following functional change was made in 1.32.300-gke.85:

  • Updated the validation checks for cluster upgrades to enforce the cluster version skew rules for user clusters. If the upgrade version information for a user cluster doesn't comply with the version skew rules, the upgrade is halted.
entry.summary: Cluster upgrade validation updated.
entry.title: Changed: Cluster Upgrade Validation

entry.content:
The following issues were fixed in 1.32.300-gke.85:

  • Fixed a known issue where Keepalived failover is blocked when the corresponding HAProxy instance is unreachable. This issue prevented the control plane VIP from being made available on a new, healthy node.
  • Fixed an issue where the CronJob for periodic health checks wasn't updating after configuration changes.
  • Fixed vulnerabilities listed in Vulnerability fixes.
entry.summary: Keepalived failover and CronJob health checks resolved.
entry.title: Fixed: Fixed control plane VIP and health check issues

entry.content: For information about the latest known issues, see Google Distributed Cloud for bare metal known issues in the Troubleshooting section.
entry.summary: This document outlines the known issues for Google Distributed Cloud for bare metal.
entry.title: Issue: Known Issues

entry.content:

After a release, it takes approximately 7 to 14 days for the version to become available for installations or upgrades with the GKE On-Prem API clients: the Google Cloud console, the gcloud CLI, and Terraform.

If you use a third-party storage vendor, check the Ready storage partners document to make sure the storage vendor has already passed the qualification for this release of Google Distributed Cloud for bare metal.

entry.title: Announcement: New version of Google Distributed Cloud for bare metal available

entry.content:
The following functional changes were made in 1.31.700-gke.72:

  • Updated the validation checks for cluster upgrades to enforce the cluster version skew rules for user clusters.
entry.summary: Validation checks for cluster upgrades have been updated to enforce version skew rules for user clusters.
entry.title: Changed: Cluster Upgrade Validation Updated

entry.content:
The following issues were fixed in 1.31.700-gke.72:

  • Fixed vulnerabilities listed in Vulnerability fixes.
entry.summary: The latest release 1.31.700-gke.72 includes fixes for reported vulnerabilities, addressing security concerns outlined in the documentation.
entry.title: Fixed: Fixed vulnerabilities in release 1.31.700-gke.72

entry.content: For information about the latest known issues, see Google Distributed Cloud for bare metal known issues in the Troubleshooting section.
entry.summary: This is a longer summary detailing the known issues for Google Distributed Cloud for bare metal, with a link to the troubleshooting documentation for the latest information.
entry.title: Issue: Known Issues in Google Distributed Cloud for bare metal

entry.content:
Google Distributed Cloud for bare metal 1.30.1100-gke.67 is now available for download. To upgrade, see Upgrade clusters. Google Distributed Cloud for bare metal 1.30.1100-gke.67 runs on Kubernetes v1.30.12-gke.800.

After a release, it takes approximately 7 to 14 days for the version to become available for installations or upgrades with the GKE On-Prem API clients: the Google Cloud console, the gcloud CLI, and Terraform.

If you use a third-party storage vendor, check the Ready storage partners document to make sure the storage vendor has already passed the qualification for this release of Google Distributed Cloud for bare metal.
entry.summary: The latest version of Google Distributed Cloud for bare metal, 1.30.1100-gke.67, is now available for download and upgrade. This version runs on Kubernetes v1.30.12-gke.800. Please note that it may take 7-14 days for this version to be available through GKE On-Prem API clients, and users with third-party storage should verify compatibility with their vendor.
entry.title: Announcement: New Version of Distributed Cloud for Bare Metal Released

entry.content:
The following issues were fixed in 1.30.1100-gke.67:

  • Fixed vulnerabilities listed in Vulnerability fixes.
entry.summary: This release includes fixes for vulnerabilities listed in the [Vulnerability fixes](https://cloud.google.com/kubernetes-engine/distributed-cloud/bare-metal/docs/vulnerabilities) documentation.
entry.title: Fixed: Fixed vulnerabilities

entry.content: For information about the latest known issues, see Google Distributed Cloud for bare metal known issues in the Troubleshooting section.
entry.summary: This is a longer summary detailing the known issues for Google Distributed Cloud for bare metal, with a link to the troubleshooting section for more information.
entry.title: Issue: Known Issues

entry.content:
Google Distributed Cloud for bare metal 1.32.200-gke.104 is now available for download. To upgrade, see Upgrade clusters. Google Distributed Cloud for bare metal 1.32.200-gke.104 runs on Kubernetes v1.32.4-gke.1000.

After a release, it takes approximately 7 to 14 days for the version to become available for installations or upgrades with the GKE On-Prem API clients: the Google Cloud console, the gcloud CLI, and Terraform.

If you use a third-party storage vendor, check the Ready storage partners document to make sure the storage vendor has already passed the qualification for this release of Google Distributed Cloud for bare metal.
entry.summary: Google Distributed Cloud for bare metal 1.32.200-gke.104 is available for download and upgrade. This version runs on Kubernetes v1.32.4-gke.1000. Please check storage partner qualifications if you use a third-party vendor.
entry.title: Announcement: New version of Google Distributed Cloud for bare metal available

entry.content:
The following issues were fixed in 1.32.200-gke.104:

  • Fixed a known issue where Keepalived failover is blocked when the corresponding HAProxy instance is unreachable. This issue prevented the control plane VIP from being made available on a new, healthy node.
  • Fixed an issue that caused nodes to get stuck in maintenance mode. Health checks have been updated so that the network check job skips connectivity checks for nodes that are in maintenance mode.
  • Fixed vulnerabilities listed in Vulnerability fixes.
entry.summary: The new release 1.32.200-gke.104 includes fixes for Keepalived failover issues, nodes getting stuck in maintenance mode, and various security vulnerabilities.
entry.title: Fixed: Fixed release 1.32.200-gke.104

entry.content: For information about the latest known issues, see Google Distributed Cloud for bare metal known issues in the Troubleshooting section.
entry.summary: This is a longer summary.
entry.title: Issue: This is a short title.

If you use a third-party storage vendor, check the Ready storage partners document to make sure the storage vendor has already passed the qualification for this release of Google Distributed Cloud for bare metal.

The following functional change was made in 1.32.300-gke.85:

  • Updated the validation checks for cluster upgrades to enforce the cluster version skew rules for user clusters. If the upgrade version information for a user cluster doesn't comply with the version skew rules, the upgrade is halted.
entry.summary: Cluster upgrade validation updated.
entry.title: Changed: Cluster Upgrade Validation

entry.content:
The following issues were fixed in 1.32.300-gke.85:

  • Fixed a known issue where Keepalived failover is blocked when the corresponding HAProxy instance is unreachable. This issue prevented the control plane VIP from being made available on a new, healthy node.
  • Fixed an issue where the CronJob for periodic health checks wasn't updating after configuration changes.
  • Fixed vulnerabilities listed in Vulnerability fixes.
entry.summary: Keepalived failover is now unblocked when HAProxy is unreachable, CronJob health checks update correctly, and vulnerabilities are fixed.
entry.title: Fixed: Fixed Keepalived and CronJob issues

entry.content: For information about the latest known issues, see Google Distributed Cloud for bare metal known issues in the Troubleshooting section.

Upgrades and new installations will be available via the Google Cloud console, gcloud CLI, and Terraform in 7 to 14 days. Ensure your third-party storage vendor is qualified for this release.

entry.content:
Google Distributed Cloud for bare metal 1.32.100-gke.106 is now available for download. To upgrade, see Upgrade clusters. Google Distributed Cloud for bare metal 1.32.100-gke.106 runs on Kubernetes v1.32.4-gke.200.

After a release, it takes approximately 7 to 14 days for the version to become available for installations or upgrades with the GKE On-Prem API clients: the Google Cloud console, the gcloud CLI, and Terraform.

If you use a third-party storage vendor, check the Ready storage partners document to make sure the storage vendor has already passed the qualification for this release of Google Distributed Cloud for bare metal.
entry.summary: The new version 1.32.100-gke.106 of Google Distributed Cloud for bare metal is now available for download and upgrade. This version runs on Kubernetes v1.32.4-gke.200. Please note that it may take 7-14 days for this version to be available through GKE On-Prem API clients, and third-party storage vendors should verify their compatibility.

entry.content: Introduced an Envoy sidecar into the GKE Identity Service to increase security, reliability, and performance.
entry.summary: The GKE Identity Service now includes an Envoy sidecar, enhancing security, reliability, and performance.
entry.title: Changed: Envoy Sidecar Added to GKE Identity Service
